title: LoL Launcher updates my desktop shortcuts every time I start the launcher
body: This started happening probably 2 or 3 days ago, and ever since then I've been getting the pop-up that says something along the lines of "League of Legends will now update your desktop shortcuts, your operating system may ask for administrator privileges" (or something like that). Now, this isn't like a huge game-breaking bug or anything, but I was just curious if others have been encountering this.

replies.body: Huh....yea that's honestly pretty weird that it's happening so often. Kind of sounds like the shortcuts aren't actually being updated properly at all. Try running a quick repair if you can, and let me know if that helps at all.
this is happening to me as well. I don't have any shortcuts on my desktop though. I just use the file explorer on windows. How do I run a "quick repair"?
Just open LeagueClient.exe, not lol.launcher.exe and you should be fine.
Thanks mate. Its been happening for over a month. Such a simple fix lol
That fixed it for me! TY GLHF

I found out why it's happening! According to [this](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005665088-Installing-the-updated-League-client#h2) page of Riot Support regarding the updated client, it will try to automatically convert your [old](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/article_attachments/115009860308/legacy-icon-small.jpg) desktop shortcuts to the [new](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/article_attachments/115009860288/new-icon-small.jpg) set of desktop shortcuts. However, a long time ago, before the client update, I pinned the LoL Launcher shortcut to my start menu, as seen [here](https://i.imgur.com/9tQAhi9.png). Now, since the shortcut I'm using is still the legacy shortcut, the Launcher will automatically try to update any legacy shortcuts on the desktop to the new shortcuts. But because the shortcut I'm using isn't technically on the desktop, it fails and has to try every time.

I don't understand why it only really started happening a few days ago, but unpinning the legacy shortcut and pinning the new shortcut to the start menu resolved the issue. This might also be an issue when using Windows Classic Shell, if the Launcher doesn't know where to find the shortcut.

This same issue was happening to me, but I launch my games (including league) through steam, and the same fix applies.
If the game shortcut was saved to a location that's not on the desktop before the "shortcut update" it will constantly try to update it without being able to. Resave a new shortcut in the same location you had it before and it will fix itself. 
GG <3

- I do not have a League of Legends desktop icon, 
- I do not have it pinned to task bar
- Running the "Quick Repair" does not fix it
- Running LeagueClient.exe does not fix it

It pops up this EVERY SINGLE TIME I start League no matter what. Can you please add a box "Do not show this me again"

Thank you so much.
